intro: Leptoderris nyanzae, commonly known as the Nyanza tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
